page.title: 17ANIMALS IN THE DORNIE AREA.
page.content: There are very many wild animals round the school.In the area of Dornie animals which are rare elsewhere are quite common.On the hills can be found red and roe deer,foxes,pine martins, wild cats and badgers.On the shore are otters and in the loch are seals.The most interesting birds of prey are golden eagles,buzzards,kestrels and sparrow hawks.Ravens are quite common and there are many herons on the rivers and lochs.The most important animal is possibly the golden eagle which is attracting much publicity because it is taking lambs in the Glenelg area.Mr Grant believes this is because there is a very great number of eagles and they have destroyed all their natural food such as hares, rabbits and ptarmagan.
